originalText.text: 10/10 experience. Throughout the haircut, Mo was meticulous in his work and paid attention to every detail. He made sure to check in with me regularly to ensure that I was happy with the length and style. The end result was a haircut that exceeded my expectations - I left the barbershop feeling brand new.

He made sure to check in with me regularly to ensure that I was happy with the length and style. The end result was a haircut that exceeded my expectations - I left the barbershop feeling brand new.

originalText.text: It’s this a barber shop or a rap studio . How does someone ran two business out of one space . I appreciate a black own business . But you can’t have a profession barber shop with high prices . Then drawing my haircut have a film crew come in and work well other smoke and drink marijuana out side . It’s sad to see what look like a profession upscale establish turn into a hang out at night . The owner really needs to get it together and figure out what she wants . Because there now a barber shop across the street with so older gentleman that seem to have it together . I hate discretion are people but I had to

originalText.text: Had a great experience. The atmosphere was comfortable. As a mother to a young boy, I’ve had awful experiences at other barber shops in the past which included inappropriate talk, drinking, loud music and being too crowded.  This shop was clean and spacious. The barber immediately greeted us upon our arrival. The seat was thoroughly sanitized in between haircuts. My son also liked that the barber engaged with him throughout the haircut. We will definitely be back!

originalText.text: Looks like a good place.  Just wish there was less wait time.

text.text: Looks like a good place.  Just wish there was less wait time.

originalText.text: So I went to Harlem Cutz East for an "afro shaping/Blowout/Hot Towel" but unfortunately got none of the above. My appointment was with Bryan and it seemed like it was his first time cutting hair. I had an appointment with him and had to request he shape up my afro three times and each time he tired to give me a shape up of my hairline. After the third time I described everything he needed to do in detail (I had already detangled my hair, so the hard part was done) but then he just asked how short I wanted. When I gave an estimate, he grabbed a chunk of my hair and just cut it off. He then proceeded to just grab chunks of my hair and cut it off based off the first cut. My hair was then terribly misshapen and I had to do my best to get the parts he missed. I'm really disappointed because I have barbers I usually go-to out in BK and was just hoping to find someone closer by and was so hopeful after all the positive reviews and their site having a dedicated section for afro-shaping. Really disappointed with how this all ended up
